But during that 90 days, you're not paying anything for PC Recruiter, but you are getting some training as you're looking at that. So if it happens that it might get done in 60 days, maybe you could even have training done inside of 90 days. But usually we allow 90 days for the conversion, 30 days after that for most of the training. And the training is customized to you. So it's going to be group training on the phone, but maybe you have admins do the first training because only the people that are going to be admins need to know how to configure things. So a lot of flexibility in that. And they'll kind of go over how you're going to use the software. Pipelines are going to be of great importance. So they'll spend a little extra time on that. And what does support look like from you guys? Support? So you actually have one dedicated trainer. You have that person's direct contact info. You can reach out to them. They're going to do all your trainings. You have me as an account manager. There's also a support line you can dial in. That'll ring the whole team. Anyone who answers can help. There's a chat on our website. So you can do the support chat on the website. We have an LMS. If you want to train on your own, kind of go through your own different units and tests and different things on PC Recruiter. We also have a YouTube channel and a Learning Center. Our Learning Center is going to have direct how-to's, videos, all sorts of things about that that you have access to every time. So a lot of different avenues to get started. Do you guys offer any sort of free trial that doesn't include like us implementing any data just kind of messing around in the system? I could send you the link to this very database that we looked at today. Let you poke in. It's a live database so don't put anything personal in there but but it is where you can log into an actual real-time live database on our cloud servers see what it's like click through it on your own so you can do that too okay and then from a scalability standpoint you know we're a business that's probably not slowing down so are there fees to continue to add businesses within the platform is there any you know as we're growing outside of like the seats that we would maybe add is there any sort of cost to scaling this platform for us only if you need to buy more training. So the training that's included is initial. It's for your setup. It's a good six months after your conversion's done. So if you use up all the training, you might need to buy more training down the line. It's only $95 an hour or $80 an hour, four hours or more. But there's no, just adding users, it's just kind of add that many user monthly fees, no additional cost. But as far as like if we're adding features, we need to customize the platform again. Like does that cost money as we grow? I know we're going to have it set up that allows us to to kind of add those businesses? We train you how to do it so you know how to do it. And if you need a little assistance, give us a call and the team will help you. And that's part of the training. Yeah, if you said, I want you to design a whole web page to go into this company's site, there might be a little consulting charges with that for our web team. But you have that support. You can do that, though, if we need to continue to grow it in ways that's beyond what they should. Okay, cool. Yeah, and then we'll open an API that you can have access to. if you had anyone that wanted to write an integration query the API yeah you can work with that as well okay do you guys have a mobile app we do very simple it's not everything but it's simple access to they I mean we're not amazed phone numbers email stuff like that I'll be honest with you I'll probably never use the mobile app it's just a question that's on here for some of the folks okay and then as far as like security and compliance goes you know there's a chance we're moving to become a federal contractor is that anything you guys have like background knowledge on not that like we have a lot of that information prepared as well but in terms of how things have to be set up or like any legal processes is that stuff you guys ever get involved with we don't usually make any kind of recommendations but we do have federal contractors using our database uh and i do have a network security policy that i can send that once we get further down the road that goes over all the policies procedures everything like that that's kind of what i was asking and then what is your like breakdown of staffing agencies that use this platform compared to like internal businesses like ourselves? Probably a little heavier on the recruiting agency side, which is why they work like an agency, that's a great fit. We do have internal workers, corporate HR, but the lion's share is probably permanent placement contracts, retained everybody, but pretty much the recruiting. That's what we want. We're leaning towards a platform that is heavier on that side just based on the way we operate, so that's good to hear. Yeah, we're a good match in that space. Okay. Well, I'll tell you what, man. I think this covers a lot of what I need to get done. I am going to recommend we – like I would imagine for a second demo, do you have like an engineer or someone that jumps on to dive in deeper? If I have someone else, is it similar to this? Usually I can hold my own in it. I've been doing this 26 years here. Okay, no, that's fine. That's fine. But if needed, I do have some other people I can pull on a trainer. The trainers usually know a little bit more if you want to really get in the weeds. Or if you know you want to get in the weeds about something, I can include a trainer on the demo. I can certainly do that. Of course, of course. Okay. I would just want my colleague that I'm going through this process with to probably go through a similar demo after I talk to her. So that would be my recommended next step. Is that all right with you? Sure, sure, sure. Yeah, I can show her around, certainly. Have her reach out. Yeah, I'll make the recommendation. I think this is probably one of the ones we want to pursue a little further. Like I said, in terms of our cutting down to five compared to the 15 we're talking to, this seems to fit a lot of what we're looking for. It's smooth. I like the interface. So, yeah, I just need to talk to my team, and then I think I can reach back out to you, or you can follow up with me this week in terms of the next step. Perfect. I'll put a follow-up down for maybe Friday morning if I haven't heard anything from you, if that's reasonable. That sounds good. All right. Fantastic. Very well. Well, I'll check. I look forward to hearing from you, and we can take that next step whenever we're ready. and if I don't hear from you, but like I said, by Friday morning, I'll give you a holler. Sounds good, man. Thank you so much for running through all this. Thank you, sir. All right. Have a great day. Goodbye.

segments.speaker: SPEAKER_01

segments.text: and we also don't have the ability to create like a task list where you would kind of log in and say hey these are the things that I scheduled out for myself today a lot of what we're doing now is just done via Outlook us manually creating events within our Outlook calendar and not necessarily being able to tie tasks or next steps to a candidate within the system okay excellent excellent yeah we can handle all of that certainly and it kind of makes sense how you said you recruit very much like an agency you're treating each of these sub sub organizations like their own unique company we can do that we yeah so we can create different pipelines so you could when you put in a job based on what company it's for you can pick what pipeline it's going to be you can have as many of those as you wish so we can certainly handle that so let me share my screen to kind of show you around here i'm going to show you here so let me know when you see my sign in screen you should be looking at that momentarily yep uh It's starting to change.

segments.speaker: SPEAKER_01

segments.text: Like, you know, one company might have three interview categories that we're going to push a candidate through, whereas another might just have two.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_01

transcription.summary:
This conversation appears to be a demo of the PC Recruiter software platform with a potential client. The client is asking questions about the features and functionality of the platform, as well as its pricing, implementation process, and scalability.

Here are some key points that can be gleaned from this conversation:

* The client is looking for a recruitment management system to help them manage their hiring processes.
* They have 15 potential vendors they are considering, but are narrowing it down to 5 based on their research.
* The PC Recruiter platform seems to meet many of the client's needs, including its interface, features, and scalability.
* The client is interested in learning more about the implementation process, pricing, and support offered by PC Recruiter.
* They would like to schedule a follow-up demo with another member of their team after they have discussed it further internally.

Some potential next steps for this conversation could include:

* Scheduling a follow-up demo with the client's colleague
* Providing additional information about the implementation process, pricing, and support offered by PC Recruiter
* Addressing any specific questions or concerns the client may have
* Discussing how PC Recruiter can be customized to meet the client's specific needs
